meanings.sent1: She had enoughs of apples to make a pie.
meanings.sent2: The store had enoughs of milk for everyone.
meanings.sent3: The picnic had enoughs of ants joining the feast.
meanings.sent4: His collection of stamps was enoughs to fill a whole album.
meanings.sent5: The jar had enoughs of marbles to play a game.

meanings.definition: Adequate to meet a need or purpose
meanings.sent1: The small backpack was enoughs for the short hike.
meanings.sent2: Her explanation was clear enoughs for everyone to understand.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella was enoughs to keep the rain away.
meanings.sent4: His skills were enoughs to impress the judges.
meanings.sent5: The cake was sweet enoughs for the party guests.

meanings.definition: As much or as many as required
meanings.sent1: He had enoughs money to buy the new toy.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for enoughs sugar to make it sweet.
meanings.sent3: The team had enoughs players to compete in the tournament.
meanings.sent4: Her energy was enoughs to finish the race strong.
meanings.sent5: The suitcase had enoughs clothes for the weekend trip.
